Do you know where to find high-paying clients?

I can help. If you want complete clarity about where your next project will come from, keep reading.

I’m going to walk-through how I’ve created a pipeline of new work opportunities for hundreds of people who make a living building websites.

In your inbox, every morning. And pairs great with a cup of coffee.

I know you’re simply too busy to line up new work. After all, you’ve got a business to run, meaning clients, paperwork, taxes, employees, and oh yea, the actual work.

But not keeping up with sales is a recipe for disaster.

I don’t need to tell you how much dry spells suck. They’re extremely stressful. It feels like every prospect you talk to is the end all be all. They makes you seem desperate, and clients can smell it.

It’s a horrible feeling. But there’s relief.

Stop putting too many eggs in one client’s basket.

A few years into freelancing, I conducted a survey of over 500+ freelancers and asked:

  • What do you do when you run out of work?
  • How much do you make?

40% said they use social media when in a dry spell, while 24% said they sit and wait, and only 12% emailed prospects.

This seemed reasonable until I correlated each of these to their income and found one group made way more than the others.

The people who emailed prospects made 50% more money than those who did nothing.

Yet almost no one did it. In fact, close to 90% overlooked sending emails.

For me, it meant the power to change my freelancing fortune. So I had to experiment. I cold emailed one new client every day for weeks and soon my income tripled.

Consulting doesn’t have to be feast or famine.

Let’s face it you’re probably busy with client work.

You tell yourself it’s okay to let up on new sales because you’ll “pick things back up once everything calms down”. But the truth is, by then it’ll be too late.

Instead of relying on your current batch of clients, keep a small daily amount of sales activity active in your business.

But how, you ask?

Presenting a hands-free way to get high-value project leads daily

It’s simple.

I monitor hundreds of websites that post projects daily. I remove the full-time jobs, low-paying work and filter out anything else that’s not relevant to you.

I editorialize the day’s best project opportunities into one easy-to-read email.

The result is high-value hyper-relevant potential clients delivered to your inbox every day.

Algorithm? I am the algorithm. I literally hand curate your daily list of leads every business day.

Want to see what's sent? Preview a few recent leads I've sent

Here’s the full list of what you get:

  1. 300+ websites monitored for you by hand every morning.
    If you did this level of lead generation yourself, you’d be losing well over $2,000+ in billable hours each month. Plus it would suck. Instead you get only the qualified opportunities from hundreds of websites.

  2. Bonus: I buy RFPs and share them with you.
    On top of job boards monitoring I buy dozens of RFPs every month and send you the handful that are realistic and easy to respond to. Over $100/month worth of RFPs, easy.

  3. Bonus #2: I find you contact info too
    I dig up a contact name, email, photo + my deep contemplating / beard-rubbing stamp of approval. A key time saver worth $100/month even if you hired the cheapest VA on the planet.

Here’s how to apply:

I limit the number of customers I have to just 60 because I want to keep the lead-to-customer ratio extremely high.

Since starting this service it’s resulted in over $1 million dollars of paid client work so I want to keep that value going.

The only way to do that is to be meticulous about who I let in. That’s why I ask new members to apply, deny people who aren’t a good fit, and close registrations when we’re full.

If you’re interested (and I have room) use one of the links below to send me your application.

Applying takes a minute or two and costs $199 (refund if denied).

That also goes to your first month’s payment and after that it’s only $199 per month. There’s no contract and you can cancel any time.
